name: QP
detail:
"Synthesis Resource"
A Quantum Particle.
A fluctuation in the spiritron that grants many possibilities.
Used as fuels to conduct all sorts of magecraft.

name: Saint Quartz
detail:
Stone with divine power.
A crystallization of concepts that decides many a future.
Also called pseudo-spiritron crystal.

name: Mana Prism
detail:
"Exchange Item"
Crystal created by concentrating mana.
Mana is the magic energy filling the planet.

name: Friend Point
detail: Proof of friendship.

name: Lantern of Chaldea
detail:
"Bond Limit Release Material"
A lantern that can light the way to improbable miracles. It is said that it can exceed even limits set in place by the Throne itself, but only at the observatory that oversees humanity.

name: Summon Ticket
detail:
"Summon Item"
A tool used to aid summons.
A glimmering guide that leads the path across eras.

name: Code Remover
detail:
"Command Code Detach Item"
A device that allows a Command Code that was engraved on any Command Card to be detached.

name: Phoenix Feather
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Feather from a sacred bird of the Orient.

name: Seed of Yggdrasil
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A seed of a giant tree that symbolizes the world.

name: Proof of Hero
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Proof that you've been acknowledged as a hero.
Many possess it, but they aren't 
conscious of it so they forget.

name: Void's Dust
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Dust that disperses when hollow shadows disappear.

name: Dragon's Reverse Scale
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A scale that grew upside-down under a dragon's chin.

name: Claw of Chaos
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Those wounded by this claw become prisoners of chaos.

name: Ghost Lantern
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Lantern that uses souls as fuel to burn.

name: Serpent Jewel
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A jewel as if you are being stared by serpent eyes.

name: Eternal Gear
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Dream of an eternal machine.
A gear that spins forever once it starts turning.

name: Forbidden Page
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A page which nobody should ever read.
Usually mixed in as the first or last page.

name: Dragon Fang
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
The fang of a dragon. Dragon Tooth Warriors are created using these fangs.

name: Meteor Horseshoe
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A tough horseshoe made of metal from a meteor.
Even if the elements are the same, since it wasn't created on Earth, it has a special role.

name: Homunculus Baby
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
The body of a young homunculus before a soul is written into it.

name: Octuplet Crystals
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A multi-crystal created within a golem's body.

name: Evil Bone
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Ominous bones wielding curses.

name: Heart of the Foreign God
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
The heart of a savage demi-god.
A god is a god, even if it's a fake.
Its heartbeat emits many curses.

name: Spirit Root
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A root where an earth elemental resides.
If you plant this root onto a statue,
it will soon start moving as if it were alive.

name: Warhorse's Young Horn
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A small horn growing on the head of
a two-horned beast that is hiding within its hair.
When the large horn breaks, this horn immediately grows and becomes the new horn.

name: Tearstone of Blood
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
The crystal of the tear shed by a giant eyeball-like creature when it dies.
A strong curse is residing within this crystal.

name: Black Beast Grease
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A fatty tissue collected from the skin of a soul-eating beast.
By repeatedly refining it through distillation and purification, it turns into a high-quality magical resource.

name: Fool's Chain
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A chain created to bind down transient souls into this world, keeping them from ascending to heaven.

name: Lamp of Evil-Sealing
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A fascinating lamp that is said to
have sealed in an elemental
with tremendous magical energy.

name: Great Knight Medal
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A medal honoring a great knight's loyalty and merit.

name: Scarab of Wisdom
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A sacred ornament that symbolizes rebirth and regeneration.
Given only to the truly wise who can solve complex problems.

name: Shell of Reminiscence
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
The shell of a clam that has lived for an eternity.
When you put your ear against the aperture, you can hear the sounds of pure waves from the distant past.

name: Deadly Poisonous Needle
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
It is said that anyone who is infected by this poison will not die immediately, but experience multiple deaths until their soul itself rots away.

name: Primordial Lanugo
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Beast fur oddly resembling a fiercely burning fire.
It is valued as a talisman to ward off evil due to its divinity.

name: Cursed Beast Gallstone
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A stone whose curse fermented in the innards of a hexed beast.
It continues to release a strong curse that will never fade.

name: Mystic Spinal Fluid
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A potion to turn an ordinary human into a mage. When injected into the spine, it creates temporary artificial Magical Circuits.

name: Mysterious Divine Wine
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
This precious wine was brewed over a long period of time to be offered to the gods. It can intoxicate even monsters and demonic beasts.

name: Refined Magatama
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A Magatama that possesses faint life energy.
A Magatama is said to be shaped like a crescent moon, a fetus, or even a soul. However, its true purpose is veiled in mystery.

name: Stake of Wailing Night
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A stake driven into a corpse to prevent its reanimation.
It never rusts, and retains its luster by absorbing blood.
It can even pierce otherworldly beings that lurk in the dark of night.

name: Mystic Gunpowder
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Custom made gunpowder that ignites when the user focuses magical energy into it.
Since it can generate a massive amount of firepower with only a small amount of magical energy, it's widely utilized as ammunition to hunt Demonic Beasts.

name: Eternal Ice
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
Ice that does not melt, even at room temperature.
Some see a lovely crystalline flower, but those with no appreciation of beauty see only a piece of ice.

name: Aurora Steel
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A piece of divine steel that glistens like the flickering aurora.
The Valkyries from Norse mythology are said to have soared through the heavens wearing armor made of this steel.

name: Giant's Ring
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A ring that is far too massive for a human to wear. Colored with legend and fantasy, it reminds one of the prosperity of ages past.

name: Soundless Bell
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
An enchanted bell made using the techniques of the sages. The sound it makes when rung is inaudible. It has a soothing effect, and can also control tractable animals such as horses.

name: Reactor Core of Dawn
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A reactor core that shines as brightly as the morning sun. The mysteries of its technology are based on sage techniques, and can be explained neither by modern science nor magecraft.

name: Tsukumo Mirror
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A mirror that has been passed down over many years, eventually coming to house mysterious entities such as divine and evil spirits.

name: Crystallized Lore
detail:
"Skill Up & Ascension Material"
A highly pure crystal of magic created
when human history crosses a stream of Mana.
It can be said that it is the ingredient for materializing Heroic Spirits.

name: Saber Piece
detail:
"Ascension Material"
A piece signifying the Saber class.

detail:

A piece signifying the Archer class.

name: Holy Grail
detail:
A container said to grant any wish.
Created by the Third Magic, it is said 
that it can materialize those that do not possess forms.

detail: At the 'Master Recruitment Campaign Exchange' of the Da Vinci Workshop, you can use this item to exchange for 1 out of the 10 available Servants.

Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Honnoji."

"Event Points"
Event points obtained at "GUDAGUDA Honnoji."
...Supposedly!

name: Golden Skull

"Event Item/Ascension Material"
A stunning golden skull accessory!
Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Honnoji."

name: Mini Ribbon
detail:
"Event Item"
A cute ribbon to decorate the Christmas tree
obtained during "Almost Weekly Santa Alter."

name: Silver Bell
detail:
"Event Item"
A divine bell to hang on the Christmas tree
obtained during "Almost Weekly Santa Alter."

name: Gold Star
detail:
"Event Item"
The star shining bright atop the Christmas tree obtained during "Almost Weekly Santa Alter."

name: Magical Stocking
detail:
"Event Item"
A stocking filled with children's wishes, 
obtained during "Almost Weekly Santa Alter."

name: Bucket of Chicken
detail:
"Event Item/Ascension Material"
Tons of chicken, needed for any Christmas party, obtained during "Almost Weekly Santa Alter."

name: Special Exchange Ticket
detail:
"Event Item"
A mysterious ticket you receive as reward,
obtained during "Almost Weekly Santa Alter."

name: Vacuum Tube
detail:
"Event Item"
A machine part obtained during "Saber Wars."
It's an eternal mystery as to what it's used for.

name: All-Purpose Lens
detail:
"Event Item"
A machine part obtained during "Saber Wars."
A lens to observe and consolidate Particle A.
Used in warps and stuff.

name: Transistor
detail:
"Event Item"
A machine part obtained during "Saber Wars."
A signal converter, it's simple but important.
Often sold in markets.

name: Altrium
detail:
"Event Point"
A mysterious material obtained during "Saber Wars."
A superdense energy crystal. Glimmers brightly.
Said to be the symbol of the promised heroine.

name: Letter from Mash
detail:
"Event Item"
An ordinary letter from Mash that arrived
during "Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Baking Chocolate
detail:
"Event Item"
A simple chocolate obtained
during "Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of Saber
detail:
"Event Item"
A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Saber emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of Archer
detail:
"Event Item"
A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Archer emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of Lancer
detail:
"Event Item"
A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Lancer emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

detail:

A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Rider emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of Caster
detail:

A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Caster emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of Assassin
detail:

A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Assassin emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of Berserker
detail:
"Event Item"
A coin-shaped chocolate engraved with the Berserker emblem. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Choco Coin of All
detail:
"Event Item"
A coin-shaped chocolate that can be exchanged for a choco coin of any class. Obtained during
"Chocolate Lady's Commotion."

name: Hidden Key
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A key that opens a door which isn't supposed to exist.

name: Black Cat Figurine
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A very cute figurine modeled after a black cat.
Cats aren't to be licked. They are there to lick you.

name: Strawberry Ice Cream
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A very expensive looking strawberry ice cream. 
A companion for a midsummer night.

name: Mineral Water
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
Naturally processed water to make you beautiful from the inside.
...From the inside? That sounds a bit scary.

name: Sharp Knife
detail:
"Event Item/Ascension Material"
Obtained during "the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A knife forged by an experienced blacksmith. 
Usually, when you give this to someone, their mood gets better.

name: CBC2018 Special Invitation
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
An invitation handed out at the
"Chaldea Boys Collection 2018"
A wonderful surprise awaits you
at the Da Vinci Workshop!

name: Mona Lisa (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A counterfeit painting obtained during
"Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits."
A portrait of a noblewoman said to have been drawn by Da Vinci.
It's slightly different from the real one, but this is beautiful on its own.

name: Self Portrait (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A counterfeit painting obtained during
"Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits."
A supposed self-portrait of Da Vinci.
It's completely different from her actual face.

name: Vitruvian Man (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A counterfeit painting obtained during
"Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits."
A human diagram supposedly drawn by Da Vinci.
There are some deformities.

name: Manuscript (True)
detail:
"Event Item"
A manuscript obtained during
"Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits."
Many inspirational ideas created by an almighty mind
are written all over it.

name: Manuscript (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A manuscript obtained during
"Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits."
Many enciphered ridiculous stories 
are written all over it.

obtained during "Fate/Accel Zero Order."

obtained during "Revival: Fate/Accel Zero Order - LAP_2

name: Golden Rice Ball
detail:
"Event BP Recovery Item"
Obtained during "The Demonic Capital: Rashomon."
A golden rice ball fit for the truly golden one.
Curry-flavored, but mild.
When you eat it, it will make your waist light up, turn your brocade into bamboo grass, or even make your tuft look like a girl's, but only if made with Japanese rice...
Just what type of rice is this?
Recovers 8 BP during the Rashomon Raids.

name: Oni Gourd
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "The Demonic Capital: Rashomon."
A gourd that contains wine said to confuse the hearts of men.
Has the effect of facilitating the
secret desires of whoever drinks it.
More than anything, it is a very tasty wine on its own.

name: Rice Ball of Power
detail:
"Event BP Recovery Item"
Obtained during "The Demonic Capital: Rashomon."
A rice ball that represents the friendship with the animals of Mt. Ashigara.
Power will pour out of your body with just one bite!
"I'm totally pumped with motivation!"
That was the review of a Rider passing by.
Recovers 2 BP during the Rashomon Raids.

name: Divine Pill
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Sanzang Coming to the West"
It is said it can make whoever ingests it immortal.

"Yeah, that story was too good to be true!"

name: Immortal Peach
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Sanzang Coming to the West"
A kind of peach that is said to be grown in the garden of Heaven.

"I heard Wukong's stomach went south afterwards.
I guess that's what you call too much of a good thing!"

name: Pork Bun
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Sanzang Coming to the West"
A giant pork bun stuffed with a bunch of goodies.
You want to eat it while it is piping hot.

"It's my favorite, oink.
It's a shame that I grew tired of it after three bites, oink."

name: Talisman of Merits
detail:
"Event Item/Quest Access Item"
Obtained during "Sanzang Coming to the West"
A blessed talisman that provides salvation to the disciples of Buddha.

"I used to sell them when I ran out of travel money!"

name: Grand Lotus
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Sanzang Coming to the West."
A brilliant blue lotus flower like the eyes of Buddha.

"It blooms most beautifully in the middle of the mud,
which is the essence of martial arts."

name: Orb of Merits
detail:
"Event Item/Quest Access Item"
Obtained during "Sanzang Coming to the West"
A shining orb that hides all sorts of possibilities.

"Gyatei! The best part is that its shape makes it easy to hold!"

name: 3 Million DL Ticket
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
At the Campaign Exchange in the Da Vinci Workshop, you can use this item to exchange for 1 out of the 10 available 4 (SR) Servants.

* Must clear Singularity F to exchange.
* You can make the exchange until 06/20/2018 20:59 PDT

name: Dumpling of Courage
detail:
"Event Item/BP Recovery Item"

A millet dumpling overflowing with Grandma's love.

Recovers 2BP during Raids for
"The Great Tale of Demons: Onigashima."

name: Golden Dumpling
detail:
"Event Item/BP Recovery Item"

Pineapple flavor.

Recovers 8BP during Raids for
"The Great Tale of Demons: Onigashima."

detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"

detail:
"Event Item/Ascension Material"
Obtained during
"The Great Tale of Demons: Onigashima."
It is decorated with a golden bear,
a one-of-a-kind golden lighter.

name: Fresh Water
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

A necessity for organisms to live.
On a deserted island, saltwater is plentiful,
but fresh water becomes valuable.

"It's delicious! I want to guzzle it down!"
"You can't, you mad dog of a knight."

name: Food
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

Many varieties of food can be gathered on a desert island.
Fresh fruits, large fish, suspicious mushrooms.
You don't have time to pick and choose what to eat!

"How to tell a poison mushroom from a safe one? You can tell if you eat it, of course."
"Ah-hah, the stick-on-your-tongue-for-three-seconds rule, eh?"

name: Lumber
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

Lumber that you can easily gather in the jungle.
Easy to process and great for the novice survivalist.
Be careful not to chop too many down!

"This is tough... No matter how you look at it, Martha!"
"All right, I've found myself a new sandbag."

name: Stone
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

Stone easily obtained from cliff walls.
They are heavy and hard to process.
But in return, they make sturdy buildings that won't lose against rain!

"I was bored, so I shaved it to just the right shape."
"Master, you were always good at powering through projects like this..."

name: Iron
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

Metal that you can melt and process into any shape
never ceases to invigorate the urge to create.
Let's crank out lots of useful things!

"If it's okay to make a bell, I'll make a mold..."
"It's rather unsettling, so please stop that, okay?"

name: Bell-Ringing Branch
detail:
"Event Item/Ascension Material"
Obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."
A branch of the world tree infused with concentrated mana.
When shaken, a mysterious sound like a bell ringing is made.

name: Oil
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

A must for moving machinery.
It spurts out from all over the broken earth,
but it needs refinement before it can be used as a power source.

name: Cement
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

The true foundation of modern architecture.
Mix sand, gravel, and water; knead it,
then dry it to turn it into sturdy concrete.

name: Ralta Alloy
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

An alloy created by a lost civilization.
Firm, yet supple and tacky.
If used for pillars and framework,
even high-rises can be easily built like a plastic model.

name: adrom Alloy
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

An alloy created by a lost civilization.
Easy to process, with high conductivity,
making it perfect for creating machine parts with.

name: Uisce Alloy
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."

An alloy created by a lost civilization.
Light but durable, and doesn't warp with heat,
it is truly a dream alloy.
It is rare and difficult to process,
but this metal makes any impossibility possible.

name: Ge Bolg Replica
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during
"Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018."
A replica of Ge Bolg that Scthach
created by processing an ash branch.

name: Expensive Pudding
detail:
"Event Item"

"Magical Girl Cruise - Prisma Codes."
Delicious.

name: MagicalBushido Musashi
detail:
"Event Item"

"Magical Girl Cruise - Prisma Codes."

around good and evil.
This was highly rated even among adult viewers.

Elisabeth still doesn't know that Elidrum is her registered adventurer name.

name: Eiraku Coins
detail:
"Event Item"
A stack of coins.
Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

As a side note, the Mini Nobus are paid about 20 mon per hour.
They have two days off a week, benefits included.
At an employee's wedding, Nobbu stands up to give a speech, or performs a scene from "Atsumori," neither of which is altogether welcome.

name: Gold Dust
detail:
"Event Item"
Sandy natural gold.
Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

It's not the Bakumatsu unless someone heads through Alaska via Hokkaido to gather war funds, and suddenly encounters a mysterious American ninja master for some western battling, and then a mysterious map leads them straight to a gold rush!

name: Koban
detail:
"Event Item"
A gold-colored monaka cookie...I mean, koban coin.
Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

These are the monaka cookies that Nobunaga loves. Please have some.
Oh-ho...(glance) Owariya, you're evil...
Wahahahaha!
Yeah, I always wanted to try saying that!
Soon after, a mysterious geezer and his two lackeys attack.

name: Shinsengumi Point
detail:
"Event Point"
A point that praises your valor for fighting along with the Shinsengumi.
Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

name: Oda Bakufu Point
detail:
"Event Point"

Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

detail:
"Event Item/Ascension Material"

Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

An excited Nobbu chopped some pieces off the branch stored at the Shosoin, and then gave them to Chacha when she came by to hang out.
Eh? Chacha loves the tasteful container, but the little wood chips inside are more valuable?
Seriously?

name: Gold Leaf Sun Fan
detail:
"Event Item"
An auspicious fan with a sun design.
Obtained at "GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration."

It's a super-duper tasteful item that Chacha loves, but it wasn't received well by Rikyu because it was too flashy.
Chacha really doesn't care about wabi-sabi!

name: Golden Rice Ball
detail:
"Event BP Recovery Item"
Obtained during "Revival: The Demonic Capital Rashomon Short."
A golden rice ball fit for the truly golden one.
Curry-flavored, but mild.
When you eat it, it will make your waist light up, turn your brocade into bamboo grass, or even make your tuft look like a girl's, but only if made with Japanese rice...
Just what type of rice is this?
Recovers 8 BP during the Rashomon Raids.

name: Oni Gourd
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Revival: The Demonic Capital Rashomon Short."
A gourd that contains wine said to confuse the hearts of men.
Has the effect of facilitating the
secret desires of whoever drinks it.
More than anything, it is a very tasty wine on its own.

name: Rice Ball of Power
detail:
"Event BP Recovery Item"
Obtained during "Revival: The Demonic Capital Rashomon Short."
A rice ball that represents the friendship with the animals of Mt. Ashigara.
Power will pour out of your body with just one bite!
"I'm totally pumped with motivation!"
That was the review of a Rider passing by.
Recovers 2 BP during the Rashomon Raids.

name: Dumpling of Courage
detail:
"Event Item/BP Recovery Item"
Obtained during "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."
A millet dumpling overflowing with Grandma's love.

Recovers 2BP during Raids for
"Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

name: Golden Dumpling
detail:
"Event Item/BP Recovery Item"
Obtained during "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."
A golden millet dumpling.
Pineapple flavor.

Recovers 8BP during Raids for
"Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

name: Oni's Wicker Basket
detail:
"Event Item"
A wicker basket filled with riches
the oni plundered from people.
Obtained during
"Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

name: Roll of Brocade
detail:
"Event Item"
An extravagant roll of cloth that
the oni plundered from people.
Obtained during
"Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

name: Dragon Palace Coral
detail:
"Event Item"
A truly rare piece of coral the
oni plundered from people.
Obtained during
"Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

name: Swift Dog Bean
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
Beans that cut through the wind and pelt the oni with incredible speed.
Obtained during "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

When used during Raids within "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite," the effectiveness of Quick cards for all allies <including sub-members> increases by 50%.

name: Wise Monkey Bean
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
Beans that dance through the clouds and pelt the oni from all angles.
Obtained during "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

When used during Raids within "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite," the effectiveness of Arts cards for all allies <including sub-members> increases by 50%.

name: Tough Pheasant Bean
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
Beans that penetrate the void and pelt the oni with overwhelming might.
Obtained during "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite."

When used during Raids within "Revival: The Great Tale of Demons Onigashima Lite," the effectiveness of Buster cards for all allies <including sub-members> increases by 50%.

name: Fresh Water
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

A necessity for organisms to live.
On a deserted island, saltwater is plentiful,
but fresh water becomes valuable.

"It's delicious! I want to guzzle it down!"
"You can't, you mad dog of a knight."

name: Food
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

Many varieties of food can be gathered on a desert island.
Fresh fruits, large fish, suspicious mushrooms.
You don't have time to pick and choose what to eat!

"How to tell a poison mushroom from a safe one? You can tell if you eat it, of course."
"Ah-hah, the stick-on-your-tongue-for-three-seconds rule, eh?"

name: Lumber
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

Lumber that you can easily gather in the jungle.
Easy to process and great for the novice survivalist.
Be careful not to chop too many down!

"This is tough... No matter how you look at it, Martha!"
"All right, I've found myself a new sandbag."

name: Stone
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

Stone easily obtained from cliff walls.
They are heavy and hard to process.
But in return, they make sturdy buildings that won't lose against rain!

"I was bored, so I shaved it to just the right shape."
"Master, you were always good at powering through projects like this..."

name: Iron
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

Metal that you can melt and process into any shape
never ceases to invigorate the urge to create.
Let's crank out lots of useful things!

"If it's okay to make a bell, I'll make a mold..."
"It's rather unsettling, so please stop that, okay?"

name: Swimsuit of Everlasting Summer Wardrobe Key
Oil
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

A must for moving machinery.
It spurts out from all over the broken earth,
but it needs refinement before it can be used as a power source.

name: Cement
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

The true foundation of modern architecture.
Mix sand, gravel, and water; knead it,
then dry it to turn it into sturdy concrete.

name: Ralta Alloy
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

An alloy created by a lost civilization.
Firm, yet supple and tacky.
If used for pillars and framework,
even high-rises can be easily built like a plastic model.

name: adrom Alloy
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

An alloy created by a lost civilization.
Easy to process, with high conductivity,
making it perfect for creating machine parts with.

name: Uisce Alloy
detail:
"Event Item"
Resource obtained during
"Revival: Summer! Ocean! Pioneering! FGO Summer 2018 Lite."

An alloy created by a lost civilization.
Light but durable, and doesn't warp with heat,
it is truly a dream alloy.
It is rare and difficult to process,
but this metal makes any impossibility possible.

name: FGO 2019 Formal Portrait Ticket
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A ticket distributed to celebrate "Fate/Grand Order 2019 - 2nd Anniversary."
Exchangeable for a Formal Portrait Craft Essence at the Da Vinci Workshop.

name: Junk Parts
detail:
"Event Item"
A broken machine part acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"
However, the goddess argues that there is still use for it even if it's broken.

name: Titanium Plate
detail:
"Event Item"
A hard, light-weight metal plate acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"
Exterior damage is inevitable for race cars.
Preparing service equipment for the sake of the racers' safety is a consideration of the goddess.

name: Mag Wheel
detail:
"Event Item"
A high-quality racing wheel acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"
Rotation and repetition are the keys to both cars and doing business.

name: Quick Oil
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
Racing oil that won't degrade, no matter how harsh the weather conditions, acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"

name: Arts Nitro
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
A device that generates explosive acceleration by injecting gas into the engine, acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"

name: Buster Octane
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
Racing fuel with extremely high octane value, acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"

name: Golden Reed
detail:
"Ascension Material"
An item offered by the people to Ishtar to wish for a fruitful harvest, acquired from "Dead Heat Summer Race!"

name: Single Candy
detail:
"Event Item"
A piece of candy chock full of nutrients, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape." Sweets are hard to come by in prison, so it's like a precious jewel.

name: Instant Noodles
detail:
"Event Item"
Instant ramen noodles that are easy to prepare, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape."
Extremely popular amongst the prisoners.
Sometimes a fight will ensue over them.

name: Connacht Coin
detail:
"Event Item"
An antique Celtic-style coin, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape."
Circulated among prison guards.
Obviously designed by the prison warden.

name: Critical Star Spoon
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
A spoon that can accurately prod the critical and vulnerable spots of even the most solid rocks, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape."

name: Calorie Meat
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
A solid piece of meat that's been cured to perfection, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape."

name: NP Hammer
detail:
"Event Item/Boost Item"
A multipurpose hammer that can be used for various applications, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape."

name: Morning Star
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A jewel that shines brightly like Venus, acquired from "Death Jail Summer Escape."

name: Bewitching Prison Warden Look Wardrobe Key
Nero Medal (Bronze)
detail:
"Event Item"
A bronze medal given to 
participants for their merit in 
"The Return of Nero Fest - Autumn 2019."

name: Nero Medal (Silver)
detail:
"Event Item"
A silver medal given to 
the brave for their merit in 
"The Return of Nero Fest - Autumn 2019."

name: Nero Medal (Gold)
detail:
"Event Item"
A gold medal given to 
the powerful for their merit in 
"The Return of Nero Fest - Autumn 2019."

name: Crimson Petal
detail:
"Event Item"
A rose petal to praise 
Emperor Nero Claudius in 
"The Return of Nero Fest - Autumn 2019."

name: 7 Million Downloads Ticket
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A ticket received during the "7 Million Downloads Campaign."
You can exchange it for 1 out of the 42 available 4 (SR) Servants at the Da Vinci Workshop.

* You must clear Singularity F to exchange it.
* You must make the exchange by 2019-09-25 20:59 PDT.

name: Bag of Copper
detail:
"Event Collectable Item"
A bag bursting with copper coins obtained during "Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite."

One needs funds for a long journey.
You can't stay at a lodge without any money.

name: Bag of Silver
detail:
"Event Collectable Item"
A bag bursting with silver coins obtained during
"Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite."

One needs equipment for an adventure.
Get the necessary equipment at the weapon and item shops.

name: Bag of Gold
detail:
"Event Collectable Item"
A bag bursting with gold coins obtained during
"Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite."

Good equipment is expensive.
A hero shouldn't cheap out.
Buy the best and most expensive equipment.

name: Hero's Sword
detail:
"Event Boost Item"
A resplendent sword, suitable for a hero. Obtained during "Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite." Its name is Eighteen.

If used during SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins quests, Buster Card effectiveness for all allies (including sub-members) will be increased by 50%.

name: Hero's Lance
detail:
"Event Boost Item"
A shining spear, suitable for a hero. Obtained during "Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite." Its name is Bubble Age.

If used during SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins quests, Quick Card effectiveness for all allies (including sub-members) will be increased by 50%.

name: Hero's Bow
detail:
"Event Boost Item"
An elegant bow, suitable for a hero. Obtained during "Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite." Its name is One Mega Shock.

If used during SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins quests, Arts Card effectiveness for all allies (including sub-members) will be increased by 50%.

name: Hero's Mantle
detail:
"Event Boost Item"
A beautiful mantle, suitable to be worn by a hero. Obtained during "Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite." Its name is Stardian.

If used during SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins quests, NP Strength for all allies (including sub-members) will be increased by 50%.

name: Hero's Shield
detail:
"Event Boost Item"
A classy, gorgeous shield suitable to protect a hero. Obtained during "Revival: Halloween Comeback! SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins - The Seeds of Adventure - Lite." Its name is Retronia.

If used during SuperGhouls 'n Pumpkins quests, apply Invincible (3 times) for all allies (including sub-members).

name: Drill Gummy
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
A drill-shaped gummy obtained during "Halloween Strike!
Demonic Climb - Himeji Castle War."
Contrary to its appearance, it's surprisingly delicious.

name: Missile Ramune
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
A missile-shaped ramune candy obtained during "Halloween Strike!
Demonic Climb - Himeji Castle War."
It fizzes in your mouth and is delicious.

name: Beam Cookie
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
A beam-shaped cookie obtained during "Halloween Strike!
Demonic Climb - Himeji Castle War."
It looks electrifying, but it's banana flavored and delicious.

name: B Pellet
detail:
"Ascension Material"
Fuel for Mecha Eli-chan, obtained during "Halloween Strike!
Demonic Climb - Himeji Castle War."
A vivid bloodred marshmallow. It looks delicious.

name: E Reactor
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
Mecha Eli-chan's main reactor, obtained during "Halloween Strike!
Demonic Climb - Himeji Castle War."
Burning pathos overflows!

name: Spare Reactor
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A spare reactor for Mecha Eli-chan, obtained during "Halloween Strike!
Demonic Climb - Himeji Castle War."
It's super important to have a backup!

name: Fruitcake
detail:
"Event Item"
A cake with plenty of fruit on top.
Obtained during "Revival: The Little Santa Alter - Christmas 2018 - Lite"

name: Shortcake
detail:
"Event Item"
A cute cake with red strawberries.
Obtained during "Revival: The Little Santa Alter - Christmas 2018 - Lite"

name: Cheesecake
detail:
"Event Item"
A fluffy, smooth-tasting cake.
Obtained during "Revival: The Little Santa Alter - Christmas 2018 - Lite"

name: Bche de Nol
detail:
"Event Item"
A luxurious log-shaped cake.
Obtained during "Revival: The Little Santa Alter - Christmas 2018 Lite"

name: Miracle Stockings
detail:
"Event Item"
A stocking filled with children's dreams.
Obtained during "Revival: The Little Santa Alter - Christmas 2018 Lite"

name: Silver Exchange Ticket
detail:
"Event Item"
A special, mysterious ticket awarded from the event
"Revival: The Little Santa Alter - Christmas 2018 Lite"

name: Hollow Candle
detail:
"Event Item"
A candle that gives off a cold, hollow light, obtained during "Merry Christmas in the Underworld."
The flame is every bit as bright as a normal candle's, but it is neither hot nor able to spread.

name: Corpse Bell
detail:
"Event Item"
A bell that rings clearly for eternity, obtained during "Merry Christmas in the Underworld."
Its sound attracts the souls of the dead.

name: Snow Baby
detail:
"Event Item"
A teeny tiny baby snowman, obtained during "Merry Christmas in the Underworld."
It fits comfortably in the palm of the hand, and never melts.

name: Crystal Wreath
detail:
"Event Item"
A Christmas wreath made of crystal, obtained during "Merry Christmas in the Underworld."
A decoration made to brighten the underworld, where plants cannot grow.

name: Sand of the Underworld
detail:
"Event Item"
Powdered metal of an indigo hue, obtained during "Merry Christmas in the Underworld."
It gives off a strange magical energy.

name: Santa Mustache
detail:
"Ascension Material"
A splendid false mustache that looks exactly like the one Santa Claus himself sports, obtained during "Merry Christmas in the Underworld." Should one with the power to travel the stars put this on, she will transform into Santa immediately!
Ho ho ho!

name: War God Exchange Ticket
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A mysterious ticket awarded to children who are deemed good civilization in "Merry Christmas in the Underworld."

name: Mona Lisa (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A counterfeit painting obtained during
"Revival: Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits - Lite".
A portrait of a noblewoman said to have been drawn by Da Vinci.
It's slightly different from the real one, but it's still beautiful on its own.

name: Self Portrait (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A counterfeit painting obtained during
"Revival: Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits - Lite".
A supposed self-portrait of Da Vinci.
It's completely different from her actual face.

name: Vitruvian Man (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A counterfeit painting obtained during
"Revival: Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits - Lite".
A human diagram supposedly drawn by Da Vinci.
There are some deformities.

name: Manuscript (True)
detail:
"Event Item"
A manuscript obtained during
"Revival: Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits - Lite".
Many inspirational ideas created by an almighty mind are written all over it.

name: Manuscript (Fake)
detail:
"Event Item"
A manuscript obtained during
"Revival: Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits - Lite".
Many enciphered, ridiculous stories are written all over it.

name: Fancy Sugar
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
An ingredient used to make chocolate. It was obtained during "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
It pairs well with the bitterness of the cacao produced in the Hanging Gardens and brings out a dreamy sweetness.

name: Mystic Milk
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
An ingredient used to make chocolate. It was obtained during "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
Its mystical aroma gently envelopes the strongly acidic flavor of the cacao produced in the Hanging Gardens.

name: Coo Coo Cacao
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
An ingredient used to make chocolate. It was obtained during "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
A cacao seed produced in the Hanging Gardens. It is very bitter and acidic, but rich in flavor.

name: Flavor Boost
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
A mysterious additive obtained during "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
It extracts the endless possibilities of chocolate, and it is said that it rapidly improves the quantity of production.

name: Hanging Gardens Chocolate
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
Chocolate that's like a brick. It was manufactured in "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
Contrary to its appearance, it has a soft texture.

name: Lock-On Chocolate
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
Specially manufactured chocolate obtained during "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
It's the perfect aggressive gift.

name: Surprise Chocolate
detail:
"Event Collection Item"
Specially manufactured chocolate obtained during "Valentine's 2020 - The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine."
It's the perfect surprise gift.

name: Hidden Key
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Revival: the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A key that opens a door which isn't supposed to exist.

name: Black Cat Figurine
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Revival: the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A very cute figurine modeled after a black cat.
Cats aren't to be licked. They are there to lick you.

name: Strawberry Ice Cream
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Revival: the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
A very expensive looking strawberry ice cream. 
A companion for a midsummer night.

name: Mineral Water
detail:
"Event Item"
Obtained during "Revival: the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order."
Naturally processed water to make you beautiful from the inside.
...From the inside? That sounds a bit scary.

name: CBC 2019 Special Invitation
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
An invitation handed out at the
"Chaldea Boys Collection 2019."
A wonderful surprise awaits you
at the Da Vinci Workshop!

name: CBC 2020 Special Invitation
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
An invitation handed out at the
"Chaldea Boys Collection 2020."
A wonderful surprise awaits you
at the Pendragon Shop!

name: Pure White Rose
detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A white rose obtained during "Chaldea Boys Collection 2020."
A wonderful surprise awaits you at the Pendragon Shop!

name: Vacuum Tube
detail:
"Event Item"
A machine part obtained during "Revival: SABER WARS - Lite."
It's an eternal mystery as to what it's used for.

name: All-Purpose Lens
detail:
"Event Item"
A machine part obtained during "Revival: SABER WARS - Lite."
A lens to observe and consolidate Particle A.
Used in warps and stuff.

name: Transistor
detail:
"Event Item"
A machine part obtained during "Revival: SABER WARS - Lite."
A signal converter, it's simple but important.
Often sold in markets.

name: Altrium
detail:
"Event Point"
A mysterious material obtained during "Revival: SABER WARS - Lite."
A superdense energy crystal. Glimmers brightly.
Said to be the symbol of the promised heroine.

name: Divine Pill
detail:
"Event Item"
A kind of pill obtained during "Revival: Sanzang Coming to the West - Lite." It is said they can make whoever ingests them immortal.

"Yeah, that story was too good to be true!"

name: Immortal Peach
detail:
"Event Item"
A kind of peach that is said to be grown in the garden of Heaven. It was obtained during "Revival: Sanzang Coming to the West - Lite."

"I heard Wukong's stomach went south after eating it.
I guess that's what you call too much of a good thing!"

name: Pork Bun
detail:
"Event Item"
A giant pork bun stuffed with a bunch of goodies. It was obtained during "Revival: Sanzang Coming to the West - Lite."
You want to eat it while it is piping hot.

"It's my favorite, oink. It's a shame that I get tired of them after three bites, oink."

name: Talisman of Merits
detail:
"Event Item/Quest Access Item"
A blessed talisman that provides salvation to the disciples of Buddha. It was obtained during "Revival: Sanzang Coming to the West - Lite."

"I used to sell them for quick cash when I ran out of travel money!"

name: Grand Lotus
detail:
"Event Item"
A brilliant blue lotus flower like the eyes of Buddha. It was obtained during "Revival: Sanzang Coming to the West - Lite."

"It blooms most beautifully in the middle of the mud, which is the essence of martial arts."

name: Orb of Merits
detail:
"Event Item/Quest Access Item"
A shining orb that hides all sorts of possibilities. It was obtained during "Revival: Sanzang Coming to the West - Lite."

"The best part is that its shape makes it beyond easy to hold!"

name: Hippoplushie
detail:
Event Item
A plushie of a Hippogriff acquired from Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory.
That it looks too fat to fly just makes it cuter.

name: Fragment of the Iliad
detail:
Event Item
A piece of a tattered page acquired from Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory.
A fragment of the epic poem "Iliad" is written on it.

name: Sage's Chalk
detail:
Event Item
An old piece of chalk acquired from Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory.
Always hits its intended target (a student) when thrown (by a teacher).

name: Dracul Coin
detail:
Event Point
A magnificent coin acquired from Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory.
The crest of the Order of the Dragon is inscribed on it.

name: Leaf of Remembrance
detail:
Ascension Material
A linden tree leaf acquired from Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory.
The discoloration on it is a stain from dragon's blood.

name: Eiraku Coins
detail:
"Event Item"
A stack of coins.
Obtained at "Revival: GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration - Lite."

As a side note, the Mini Nobus are paid about 20 mon per hour.
They have two days off a week, benefits included.
At an employee's wedding, Nobbu stands up to give a speech, or performs a scene from "Atsumori," neither of which is altogether welcome.

name: Gold Dust
detail:
"Event Item"
Sandy natural gold.
Obtained at "Revival: GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration - Lite."

It's not the Bakumatsu unless someone heads through Alaska via Hokkaido to gather war funds, and suddenly encounters a mysterious American ninja master for some western battling, and then a mysterious map leads them straight to a gold rush!

name: Koban
detail:
"Event Item"
A gold-colored monaka cookie...I mean, koban coin.
Obtained at "Revival: GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration - Lite."

These are the monaka cookies that Nobunaga loves. Please have some.
Oh-ho...(glance) Owariya, you're evil...
Wahahahaha!
Yeah, I always wanted to try saying that!
Soon after, a mysterious geezer and his two lackeys attack.

name: Shinsengumi Point
detail:
"Event Point"
A point that praises your valor for fighting along with the Shinsengumi.
Obtained at "Revival: GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration - Lite."

A.K.A Okita Point.

name: Oda Bakufu Point
detail:
"Event Point"
A point that praises your valor for fighting along with the Oda Bakufu.
Obtained at "Revival: GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration - Lite."

A.K.A Nobbu Point.

name: Gold Leaf Sun Fan
detail:
"Event Item"
An auspicious fan with a sun design.
Obtained at "Revival: GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration - Lite."

It's a super-duper tasteful item that Chacha loves, but it wasn't received well by Rikyu because it was too flashy.
Chacha really doesn't care about wabi-sabi!

name: Frog Handkerchief
detail:
Event Item
A dashing handkerchief with a frog design that Oryou would drool over, acquired during GUDAGUDA Legend of the Imperial Capital Grail.

For some reason, frogs are all the rage at the Imperial Capital right now, and even the Mini Nobus are buying them all up.
During weekends at department stores, a cutthroat mini-war between Oryou and Mini Nobus scrambling to get these clearance frog handkerchiefs ensues.

But if these are on clearance, doesn't it mean they weren't that popular?
One would think, right?

name: Frog Netsuke
detail:
Event Item
A charming netsuke carved into the shape of a frog. Even Oryou drools over it. Acquired during GUDAGUDA Legend of the Imperial Capital Grail.

As you all know, frogs are all the rage right now at the Imperial Capital, and this frog netsuke is especially popular among the hip and cool youngsters.
It's a popular good luck charm with the Mini Nobus who go out to battle, and the Mini Nobus frequently drop it.

The fact that the item gets dropped all the time doesn't make it exactly lucky, don't you think?

name: Frog Incense Burner
detail:
Event Item
An elegant incense burner that Oryou would drool over...so much so that it would become a point of concern, acquired during GUDAGUDA Legend of the Imperial Capital Grail.

Believe it or not, this frog incense burner and the legendary incense burner said to have croaked when Nobbu was in a bind at Honnoji...have nothing to do with each other.

Recently, Oryou prefers to put mosquito repellant incenses inside.
The object is said to be a lucky object that brings in business, but business doesn't seem to be getting any better at this point.

name: Kaientai Banner
detail:
Ascension Material
A red and white striped banner, acquired during GUDAGUDA Legend of the Imperial Capital Grail.

A ship's emblem of the Kaientai, established by Ryouma.

The Kaientai was an organization that received funding from their patrons to conduct trade, similar to a joint-stock company in modern times. Ryouma's dream was to eventually conduct foreign trade on a global scale, but his ambition was never fulfilled.

Oryou's dream of becoming a beautiful and competent secretary also never came true.

name: Junk Parts
detail:
"Event Item"
A broken machine part acquired from "Revival: Dead Heat Summer Race! - Lite".
However, the goddess argues that there is still use for it even if it's broken.

name: Titanium Plate
detail:
"Event Item"
A hard, light-weight metal plate acquired from "Revival: Dead Heat Summer Race! - Lite".
Exterior damage is inevitable for race cars.
Preparing service equipment for the sake of the racers' safety is a consideration of the goddess.

name: Mag Wheel

"Event Item"

detail:
"Event Exchange Item"
A ticket received during the "Babylonia Anime Release Campaign: Part Two."
You can exchange it for 1 4 (SR) Servant at the Da Vinci Workshop.

* You must clear Singularity F to exchange it.
* You must make the exchange by 2020/01/29 19:59 PST.
